DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of temozolomide on a protracted schedule, after standard 5-day temozolomide regimen in patients with recurrent or progressive high grade glioma.
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy of Protracted Temozolomide in Patients With Progressive High Grade Glioma
DOC.criteria: Patient age >18 years old Histopathological diagnosis of high grade glioma (anaplastic astrocytoma or anaplastic oligodendroglioma or anaplastic oligoastrocytoma or glioblastoma multiforme) Progression after standard dose (D15/28 days)temozolomide either during recurrence or adjuvant treatment approved in Magnetic Resonance imaging Karnofsky Performance Status scale >/=50 (due to brain pathology) Adequate hematological, renal and hepatic function Patients willing to participate in the study and signing the informed consent Karnofsky Performance Status scale <50 Female patients with pregnancy or with suspicion of pregnancy. Patients with fertility will be warned for appropriate contraception during the study Patients not suitable for followup
